meanings.definition: To delegate tasks or responsibilities to an external party.
meanings.sent1: She decided to outtask the project to a professional team.
meanings.sent2: The company often outtasks their customer service to a call center.
meanings.sent3: Instead of stressing about it, she chose to outtask the difficult assignment.
meanings.sent4: Outtasking the job felt like passing a heavy burden to someone else's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: Outtasking can help lighten your workload and improve efficiency.

meanings.definition: The act of outsourcing specific tasks to a third party.
meanings.sent1: Outtasking has become a common practice in many industries.
meanings.sent2: The outtasking of IT support saved the company a lot of money.
meanings.sent3: The team celebrated the successful outtasking of their marketing campaign.
meanings.sent4: The outtasking of the project was a strategic move for the business.
meanings.sent5: Effective outtasking requires clear communication and trust in the external party.
